717715f-a.text:
UNION THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY IN NEW YORK CITY. Feb. 1929 Ewing Galloway, photographer
from the Review of Reviews
Neg. # 3986

715225f-a.text:
120th Street, north side, east from but not including Broadway to Morningside Drive. No. 525 is the Teachers College adjoining the Horace Mann School.

About 1930.

John Wallace Gillies.

715227f-a.text:
West 120th Street, south side, west from and including Broadway to Claremont Ave., showing the Barnard College Building, which contains Brinckerhoff, Milbank and Fiske Halls. This building occupies the complete block between 119th and 120th Streets, between the afore mentioned Aves. and bears No. 3025 on Broadway, which side is largely shown.
1936.
Walter L. Bogert.

717713f-a.text:
Broadway, at West 120th Street, showing in the foreground (S.W. corner), the Athletic Field of Barnard College. Across West 120th Street and partially hidden by trees, are three units, Fiske, Millbank and Brinkerhoff Halls, of the College. The latter is at the N.W. corner of the afore mentioned streets. Across its roof, appears the tower of the Admnistration and Library Buildings of the Union Theological Seminary. The large tower shown on the left, is that of the Riverside Baptist Church, which is located on Riverside
Drive, at the S.E. corner of West 122nd Street.
1936.
Walter L. Bogert.

717722f-b.text:
The Union Theological Seminary, Broadway, west side, from 122nd to 120th Streets. In the background on the right may be seen construction work on the 21-story Riverside Church (Baptist).
May 23, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)8roadway,West Si3e at the North West corner of West I20th Street,
showing the Union Theological Seminary.
September I928.
George Balgue,

717714f-a.text:
Broadway looking towards Riverside Drive about 1897 and showing Grant's Tomb, The Claremont Restaurant and Broadway.
Collection of,
George T. Magco,
8G Madison Avenue,
